children.value: Kepler-16b: The First Circumbinary Planet

) is an extrasolar planet. It is a Saturn-mass planet consisting of half gas and half rock and ice, and it orbits a binary star, Kepler-16, with a period of 229 days. "It is the first confirmed, unambiguous example of a circumbinary planet – a planet orbiting not one, but two stars," said Josh Carter of the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, one of the discovery team.

from astropy.io import fits, ascii
from astropy.time import Time
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.dates import DateFormatter
import pandas as pd


fname = 'kplr012644769-20160128150956_dvt.fits'
hdu = fits.open(fname)
data = hdu[1].data
df = pd.DataFrame({'time': data['TIME'], 'flux': data['LC_INIT']})
df['time'] = Time(df['time'] + 2454833, format='jd').datetime64
plt.plot(df['time'], df['flux'], '.', ms=3, label=fname)

fname = 'kplr012644769_q1_q16_tce_01_dvt_lc.tbl'
data = ascii.read(fname)
df = pd.DataFrame({'time': data['TIME'], 'flux': data['INIT_FLUX_PL']})
df['time'] = Time(df['time'] + 2454833, format='jd').datetime64
plt.plot(df['time'], df['flux'], '.', ms=3, c='C0', label=fname)

plt.title('Kepler-16', size=16)
plt.xlabel(r'Date ($P_{orb}=41.0778$ days)', size=16)
plt.ylabel(r'Flux ($F_e/F_o - 1$)', size=16)

date_form = DateFormatter("%b %Y")
plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_formatter(date_form)

plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.grid(ls=':')
plt.legend(markerscale=4)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig('kepler-16.png', dpi=300)
